metadata.title: CVE-2023-47470 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Ffmpeg before github commit4565747056a11356210ed8edcecb920105e40b60 allows a remote attacker toachieve an out-of-array write, execute arbitrary code, and cause a denialof service (DoS) via the ref_pic_list_struct function inlibavcodec/evc_ps.c

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavcodec60 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavdevice60 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavfilter9 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra60 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavformat60 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libavutil58 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libpostproc57 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
libswscale7 - 7:6.1-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:6.1-3ubuntu1').
